dialogue.text: Mum... you're barely here now. Just ghostly lines and fading light.
Please don't go yet. Not when I still have so much to tell you.
My sweet child, I'm holding on by threads so thin they're breaking with each word.
I can feel myself dissolving, becoming one with the emptiness between stars.
How do I tell Dad that I held you one last time and couldn't save you?
How do I wake up tomorrow knowing you're truly gone?
My darling girl, my greatest creation. You carry pieces of my soul in every breath you take.
When grief crushes your chest and you can't breathe, look to the stars. I'll be in their light, watching over you both.
My only regret is the lifetime of moments I'll miss. Your triumphs, your tears, the woman you'll become.
Promise me you won't let my absence diminish your light, Jasmine. Burn brighter because I couldn't stay.
I promise, Mum. But God, it feels impossible without you.
I'll try to be the star you always saw in me.
My beautiful, brave daughter... even as I fade, your light illuminates everything.
Let this final melody be my eternal lullaby. Sing me home, my little star.
